item.title: Cyberstarts Launches $300M Liquidity Fund to Help Startups Retain Top Talent
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
With IPOs taking longer than ever, the venture firm’s fund aims to keep startup veterans motivated while staying private.

The post Cyberstarts Launches $300M Liquidity Fund to Help Startups Retain Top Talent appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: EU Unveils AI Code of Practice to Help Businesses Comply With Bloc’s Rules
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The EU code is voluntary and complements the EU’s AI Act, a comprehensive set of regulations that was approved last year and is taking effect in phases.

The post EU Unveils AI Code of Practice to Help Businesses Comply With Bloc’s Rules appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: McDonald’s Chatbot Recruitment Platform Leaked 64 Million Job Applications
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Two vulnerabilities in an internal API allowed unauthorized access to contacts and chats, exposing the information of 64 million McDonald’s applicants.

The post McDonald’s Chatbot Recruitment Platform Leaked 64 Million Job Applications appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical Wing FTP Server Vulnerability Exploited
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Wing FTP Server vulnerability CVE-2025-47812 can be exploited for arbitrary command execution with root or system privileges.

The post Critical Wing FTP Server Vulnerability Exploited appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: TikTok Faces Fresh European Privacy Investigation Over China Data Transfers
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The Irish Data Privacy Commission announced that TikTok is facing a new European Union privacy investigation into user data sent to China.

The post TikTok Faces Fresh European Privacy Investigation Over China Data Transfers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: July 2025 Breaks a Decade of Monthly Android Patches
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Since August 2015, Google has delivered a constant stream of monthly security patches for Android. Until July 2025.

The post July 2025 Breaks a Decade of Monthly Android Patches appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Rowhammer Attack Demonstrated Against Nvidia GPU
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Researchers demonstrated GPUHammer — a Rowhammer attack against GPUs — by degrading the accuracy of machine learning models.

The post Rowhammer Attack Demonstrated Against Nvidia GPU appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: eSIM Hack Allows for Cloning, Spying
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Details have been disclosed for an eSIM hacking method that could impact many, but the industry is taking action.

The post eSIM Hack Allows for Cloning, Spying  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ingram Micro Restores Systems Impacted by Ransomware
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ingram Micro has restored operations across all countries and regions after disconnecting systems to contain a ransomware attack.

The post Ingram Micro Restores Systems Impacted by Ransomware appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Four Arrested in UK Over M&S, Co-op Cyberattacks
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Three teens and a woman have been arrested by the UK’s NCA over the hacking of M&S, Co-op and Harrods.

The post Four Arrested in UK Over M&S, Co-op Cyberattacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
